answers.answer: Hi,While I am not exactly sure what you are asking I can share the following personal experience taking Glucophage XR.When I wa diagnosed as a Type II diabetic 9 years ago I was prescribed Glucophage XR 500 mg once daily. It along with diet and exercise worked well for me in getting my glucose levels down to an acceptable level. The drug is formulated to provide effective glucose reduction over a  24 hours time period. Routine bowel movements or urination should not reduce the drugs effectiveness.Hope the above information is a little helpful,troytroy

Metformin is considered the first line of treatment for diabetes, so it is very common to be prescribed by the doctors.Metformin works on the liver, where it inhibits the liver from leaking out too much sugar in the blood stream, also it makes the cells more sensitive to the insulin...therefore helping with sugar control.Metformin does have side effects such as stomach upset, cramping, diarrhea.  To minimize the side effects of the medication, it is recommended to take the pills with meal or after meal.  This helps to distributes the medication better in the body and therefore decrease side effects.  Also sometimes, the medication does take at least 2 weeks for the body to get use to it. if side effects persist for more than 2 weeks, should talk to your health care provider about it as you might not be able to tolerate it.
